solution_line_template: If I paid ${total_paid} and I was refunded {refund_percent_num}% for all the 3 pants, then that means I received {refund_percent_num}%*{total_paid}=<<{total_paid}*{refund_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={refund_amount}>>{refund_amount}
This means the total price of the 2 shirts was {total_paid}-{refund_amount}=<<{total_paid}-{refund_amount}={price_of_2_shirts}>>{price_of_2_shirts}
The price of one shirt is thus {price_of_2_shirts}/{num_shirts}=<<{price_of_2_shirts}/{num_shirts}={price_of_1_shirt}>>{price_of_1_shirt}
